casebody.data:
Supreme Court, Kings Special Term, February, 1901.

Unreported.

In the Matter of the Application of Benjamin W. Wilson to Revoke the Liquor Tax Certificate of Leon Geisman. Gaynor, J.:

The mere fact that the boys were allowed to meet in a school building at night at a sort of club or association to keep them off the street does not enable us to say that the building is not used exclusively for school purposes.

Application granted.
